content: iris danielle comeau designs notes materials iris is the maiden goddess of the rainbow she needle also serves nectar to the goddesses and gods to 6 mm us size 10 drink gotta love that nectar of the gods 32 circular she was the messenger of the olympian gods before hermes and is also known as one of the yarn goddesses of the sea and the sky iris links the mc worsted weight 251 yds / 230 m gods to humanity she travels with the speed of cumulus by juniper moon farm wind from one end of the world to the other and 94% cotton 6% nylon 1 skein into the depths of the sea and the underworld colour blackberry as a maiden goddess i think the light and airy cc worsted weight 251 yds / 230 m feel of cotton yarn works perfectly for iris cumulus rainbow by juniper moon farm rainbow so grab your nectar of choice and knit 94% cotton 6% nylon 1ball yourself a rainbow fit for a goddess colour great reef notions darning needle abbreviations gauge 4 x 4 k knit 16 sts = 4 garter stitch kfb knit into the front and back of the same stitch a method of increasing final size co cast on 54 wingspan bobble bind off 24 depth at centre st s stitch es mc main colour cc contrasting colour © 2020 danielle comeau designs all rights reserved 2 pattern the shawl is worked from one end to the other the colours are alternated in ever widening stripes however i recommend wrapping the yarn not in use at the beginning of every row so you have a consistent look at the edge and you don t have to weave in ends aside from the beginning and end section 1 repeat row 1 - 12 4 more times 102 st co 3 sts with mc row 1 k 1 row section 4 row 2 kfb k to end of row 4 st row 1 with cc k 1 row row 3 with cc knit row row 2 kfb k to end of row 103 st row 4 kfb k to end of row 5 st row 3 - 8 repeat row 1 and 2 106 st row 5 with mc knit row row 9 with mc knit row row 6 kfb k to end of row 6 st row 10 kfb k to end of row 107 st repeat row 3-6 17 more times 40 st row 11 - 16 repeat row 9 and 10 110 st section 2 repeat row 1 - 16 one more time 118 st row 1 with cc k 1 row row 2 kfb k to end of row 41 st section 5 row 3 & 4 repeat row 1 and 2 42 st row 1 with cc k 1 row row 5 with mc knit row row 2 kfb k to end of row 119 st row 6 kfb k to end of row 43
